results.title: Get it write
results.brief_description: A guide to writing essays, reports and projects. Emphasizes the importance of a suitable approach to the topic; careful thought and research; a step by step method of writing; and the development of logical argument.

results.title: Get it together
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, Herman S. Saunders and Richard Miner
results.brief_description: Tells the true story of a young man who became a paraplegic as a result of a auto accident. Shows how he returned to college, married and began a career as a recreational therapist.

results.title: Get help - give aid
results.creator_credit: Fillinger Films, American College of Emergency Physicians and Paul Fillinger
results.brief_description: Gives us an overview of what first aid to provide in a variety of emergency situations. Shows how to use the phone to contact emergency services; how to stop the flow of blood; how to give mouth-to-mouth resuscitation; how to help a person whose clothes are on fire and how to give aid to a person who is choking. NB THE PROCEDURE FOR FIRST AID FOR CHOKING IS NOT THE PROCEDURE RECOMMENDED IN AUSTRALIA.

results.title: Get a job
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Derek Mazur, Michael Scott and Brad Caslor
results.brief_description: An animated short film that follows the tribulations of a cartoon character, Bob Dog, as he hunts for a job. Self-motivation, preparing a resume, contacting people by phone and mail, getting ready for an interview and the interview itself—all are dealt with in a highly entertaining fashion. The Motown mover Get a Job provides the upbeat musical sound track.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Derek Mazur, Michael Scott and Brad Caslor

results.title: Gestures (Captioned)
results.brief_description: The Story - Fifteen year old Jessica is partially deaf. When her hearing parents leave on an overseas trip, Jessica is left in the care of her profoundly deaf grandmother, with whom she has difficulty communicating. Embarrassed by her own hearing impairment, Jessica now finds herself caught between two worlds, belonging to neither. The Company - Gestures Theatre-of-the -Deaf comprises 14 deaf actors under the direction of Sarah Werfel (hearing) and Leonora Martin (profoundly deaf). The company devises plays based on events of importance to the deaf community. These plays are performed in mime and an Australian sign language (Auslan) for both deaf and hearing audiences.

results.title: Gesell development and neurologic examination
results.brief_description: Child development from 16 weeks observing co-ordination and muscle growth and stimulation. At 52 weeks an infant starts changing into a toddler - learning balance and finally walking at about 56 weeks.

results.title: Gertrude Stein and a companion
results.brief_description: This film is a compelling exploration of the 40 year tempestuous relationship between the legendary American writer and lecturer, Gertrude Stein, and her beloved companion, Alice B. Toklas. Based entirely on historical materials and the personal letters of Toklas, it provides an intimate portrait of these two unique and unconventional women. Stein’s thoughts on Alice, the arts, America’s Hemingway and other characters are revealed. Scenes from their public and private lives are interwoven with Alice’s recollections of their time together.

results.title: Gertie the dinosaur
results.brief_description: Gertie the dinosaur the first cartoon of any importance, was produced by Winsor McCay, a cartoonist for the New York American. It features a live-action frame, and approximately ten thousand individual drawings were used for the animation.

results.title: Germany: People of the industrial West
results.creator_credit: John T. Bobbitt and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Describes the life of people on Western Germany depicting them in a variety of occupations form the southern uplands to the Western plains in the country, village and city. Tells something of the history and cultural past of the Germans and gives an idea of life today in the major regions of Germany - the Rhineland, and uplands of the south, and the northern plains. Emphasizes the reconstruction of prosperity in spite of Germany’s war devastation and partition.

results.title: Germany: Key to Europe
results.brief_description: A report on the German problem, showing how events since World War II have made this divided nation an area of conflict between two ideologies. The film brings into focus the march of events that followed the country’s collapse and its military occupations. The political manoeuvres of the Social bloc to build a satellite state, in opposition to the wish of the Western powers for a unified, democratic Germany, are seen as major factors in the struggle.
